description.para: Updates setting configurations for your Amazon Inspector account. When you use this API as an Amazon Inspector delegated administrator this updates the setting for all accounts you manage. Member accounts in an organization cannot update this setting.

The ECR automated re-scan duration defines how long an ECR image will be actively scanned by Amazon Inspector. When the number of days since an image was last pushed exceeds the automated re-scan duration the monitoring state of that image becomes inactive and all associated findings are scheduled for closure.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the FilterArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^FilterArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

Amazon.PowerShell.Common.AWSCommonArgumentsCmdlet.Region
Amazon.PowerShell.Common.AWSCommonArgumentsCmdlet.SecretKey

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Arn'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Inspector2.Model.UpdateFilterResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Inspector2.Model.UpdateFilterResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
Amazon.PowerShell.Common.AWSCommonArgumentsCmdlet.SessionToken

This cmdlet returns a System.String object. The service call response (type Amazon.Inspector2.Model.UpdateFilterResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
